To Take a Snapshot To take a snapshot of the tenant configuration and data, you use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) Tenants (SM203520) form. Published customization are also included in the snapshot. To Take a Snapshot of Your Tenant We strongly recommend that you create snapshots in maintenance mode (that is, when the system is locked out for maintenance, as described in To Schedule the System Lockout). Otherwise, snapshots can contain corrupted data (for example, if any transactions were in progress during the creation of the snapshot). If required, sign in to the tenant whose data you want to copy. Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) Tenants (SM203520) form. In the Tenant ID box, select the tenant whose snapshot you want to create. On the form toolbar, click Create Snapshot to open the Create Snapshot dialog box. In the dialog box, notice the source tenant in the Source Tenant box. In the Description box, type a short description of the snapshot. In the Export Mode box, select the data to be included in the snapshot. Published customization are included in the snapshot automatically. If you want to create a backup of your data we recommend that you back up the Acumatica ERP database rather than create a snapshot with the Full export mode. Optional: If you want to export the snapshot immediately after creation, select the Prepare for Export check box. Alternatively, you can prepare a snapshot for export later, before exporting the snapshot, as described in To Export a Snapshot. Optional: If you have selected the Prepare for Export check box, you should specify the format the system uses to save exported data. Select one of the following: Binary : The exported data is saved in a collection of .adb files. XML : The exported data is saved in a collection of .xml files. Click OK to close the dialog box and initiate the process of creating the snapshot. Creating a snapshot may take a significant amount of time, depending on the volume of data entered for the tenant. If you plan to restore the snapshot in another tenant of your Acumatica ERP instance, click Change Visibility on the table toolbar to make the snapshot visible in other tenants of the instance. A snapshot appears in the list of snapshots on the Snapshots tab under the source tenant. You can restore the data from the snapshot any time you want to.

In a multitenant configuration, you can toggle the visibility of snapshots on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_35_20|Tenants] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) form to group them by tenant, as described below. You can distinguish snapshots with different visibility by checking the state of the '''Tenant ID''' column on the '''Snapshots''' tab:[anchor|#ul_cds_mtc_sr] *If a tenant is specified, the snapshot is visible only when you select the tenant *If the box is empty, the snapshot is visible regardless of the selected tenant ((({S:Warn}Even the snapshots with increased visibility are not visible if you sign in to another tenant. ))) ==To Change the Visibility of a Snapshot==[anchor|#ol_vhb_hw1_sr] #If required, sign in to the source tenant. #Open the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_35_20|Tenants] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) form. #Make sure that the tenant you signed in to is selected in the '''Tenant ID''' box. #On the '''Snapshots''' tab, click on the snapshot whose visibility you want to change. #On the table toolbar, click '''Change Visibility'''.

To Toggle the Visibility of a Snapshot In a multitenant configuration, you can toggle the visibility of snapshots on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) Tenants (SM203520) form to group them by tenant, as described below. You can distinguish snapshots with different visibility by checking the state of the Tenant ID column on the Snapshots tab: If a tenant is specified, the snapshot is visible only when you select the tenant If the box is empty, the snapshot is visible regardless of the selected tenant Even the snapshots with increased visibility are not visible if you sign in to another tenant. To Change the Visibility of a Snapshot If required, sign in to the source tenant. Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) Tenants (SM203520) form. Make sure that the tenant you signed in to is selected in the Tenant ID box. On the Snapshots tab, click on the snapshot whose visibility you want to change. On the table toolbar, click Change Visibility .

You can export a snapshot by using the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_35_20|Tenants] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) form. ==To Export a Snapshot==[anchor|#ol_ddj_xqs_qr] #If required, sign in to the tenants you used to take a snapshot. #Open the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_35_20|Tenants] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) form. #In the '''Tenant ID''' box, select the tenant you used to take the snapshot. #On the '''Snapshots''' tab, in the table, click the snapshot you want to restore. #If the snapshot is not ready for export (that is, the '''Ready for Export''' check box in the snapshot row is clear) or if you want to update the data in the snapshot, click '''Prepare for Export''' on the table toolbar. #:((({S:Hint}Preparing a snapshot may take a significant amount of time, depending on the volume of data entered for the tenant. ))) #:When the snapshot is ready for export, the '''Ready for Export''' check box is automatically selected for the snapshot in the table. #On the table toolbar, click '''Export Snapshot'''. #:Depending on your browser settings, the snapshot is saved to your computer.

To Export a Snapshot You can export a snapshot by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) Tenants (SM203520) form. To Export a Snapshot If required, sign in to the tenants you used to take a snapshot. Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) Tenants (SM203520) form. In the Tenant ID box, select the tenant you used to take the snapshot. On the Snapshots tab, in the table, click the snapshot you want to restore. If the snapshot is not ready for export (that is, the Ready for Export check box in the snapshot row is clear) or if you want to update the data in the snapshot, click Prepare for Export on the table toolbar. Preparing a snapshot may take a significant amount of time, depending on the volume of data entered for the tenant. When the snapshot is ready for export, the Ready for Export check box is automatically selected for the snapshot in the table. On the table toolbar, click Export Snapshot . Depending on your browser settings, the snapshot is saved to your computer.

To import a snapshot, you use the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_35_20|Tenants] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) form. A snapshot can be restored in a new database only if the version of the application match the version of the snapshot (that is, the version of the application used to take the snapshot). You can view the version of the snapshot in the ''manifest.xml'' file in the snapshot.((({S:Warn}A snapshot includes customization data from the source application. If the destination application does not include customization or includes another customization set, we recommend that you not import customization data. ))) ==To Import a Snapshot==[anchor|#ol_dv4_qx3_sr] #Open the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_35_20|Tenants] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) form. #In the '''Tenant ID''' box, select the tenant to which you want to import a snapshot. #On the '''Snapshots''' tab, in the table, click '''Import Snapshot''' on the table toolbar. #:This opens the '''Upload Snapshot Package''' dialog box. #In the '''Upload Snapshot Package''' dialog box, do the following: ##Select the snapshot file in the '''Choose File''' box. ##If you want to import customization data, select the '''Include data from Custom Columns''' check box. ##:((({S:Warn}If you import customization data, such data will be automatically restored when you restore the snapshot. ))) ##If you want the system to preliminary match the data from the snapshot with the database structure in the Acumatica ERP instance where you want to import the snapshot before import, select the '''Check Database Structure Before Import''' check box. ##:((({S:Warn}We recommend that you select this check box only if the database structure was customized in Acumatica ERP where the snapshot was taken. ))) ##Click '''Upload''' to upload the snapshot.
Uploading of the snapshot may take some time, depending on the size of the snapshot. Notice the green icon that appears on the form toolbar once the operation has completed successfully; at this time the imported snapshot appears on the '''Snapshots''' tab. (If a red icon appears, move the cursor over the red icon to view the description of the problem.)

To Import a Snapshot To import a snapshot, you use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) Tenants (SM203520) form. A snapshot can be restored in a new database only if the version of the application match the version of the snapshot (that is, the version of the application used to take the snapshot). You can view the version of the snapshot in the manifest.xml file in the snapshot. A snapshot includes customization data from the source application. If the destination application does not include customization or includes another customization set, we recommend that you not import customization data. To Import a Snapshot Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) Tenants (SM203520) form. In the Tenant ID box, select the tenant to which you want to import a snapshot. On the Snapshots tab, in the table, click Import Snapshot on the table toolbar. This opens the Upload Snapshot Package dialog box. In the Upload Snapshot Package dialog box, do the following: Select the snapshot file in the Choose File box. If you want to import customization data, select the Include data from Custom Columns check box. If you import customization data, such data will be automatically restored when you restore the snapshot. If you want the system to preliminary match the data from the snapshot with the database structure in the Acumatica ERP instance where you want to import the snapshot before import, select the Check Database Structure Before Import check box. We recommend that you select this check box only if the database structure was customized in Acumatica ERP where the snapshot was taken. Click Upload to upload the snapshot. Uploading of the snapshot may take some time, depending on the size of the snapshot. Notice the green icon that appears on the form toolbar once the operation has completed successfully; at this time the imported snapshot appears on the Snapshots tab. (If a red icon appears, move the cursor over the red icon to view the description of the problem.)

You can restore data to a tenant from any snapshot that is visible in the tenant by using the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_35_20|Tenants] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) form.((({S:Hint}In the destination tenant, a restored snapshot overwrites all the data that is not specifically protected. For more information, see [HelpRoot_Administration\SA_Using_Snapshots_GeneralInfo|Using Snapshots: General Information]. ))) If the snapshot includes customization data, such data will be restored when you restore the snapshot. If the customization set of the destination instance does not match the customization set of the snapshot, the restoration process may fail. ==To Restore Data From a Snapshot==[anchor|#ol_ssb_x4j_qr] #Sign in to the tenant where you want to restore a snapshot. #Open the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_35_20|Tenants] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) form. #In the '''Tenant ID''' box, select the tenant for which you want to restore a snapshot. #On the '''Snapshots''' tab, select the snapshot whose data you want to restore, and click '''Restore Snapshot''' on the form toolbar. #:This opens the '''Restore Snapshot''' dialog box. #Click '''OK''' in the dialog box to restore the data from the snapshot in the destination tenant and close the dialog box. #:The operation may take a long time. After the restoration process completes successfully, you are signed out of the system. If the process could not be completed, a red icon appears. To view the description of the problem, move the cursor over the red icon.

To Restore a Snapshot You can restore data to a tenant from any snapshot that is visible in the tenant by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) Tenants (SM203520) form. In the destination tenant, a restored snapshot overwrites all the data that is not specifically protected. For more information, see Using Snapshots: General Information. If the snapshot includes customization data, such data will be restored when you restore the snapshot. If the customization set of the destination instance does not match the customization set of the snapshot, the restoration process may fail. To Restore Data From a Snapshot Sign in to the tenant where you want to restore a snapshot. Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203520|SM203520]) Tenants (SM203520) form. In the Tenant ID box, select the tenant for which you want to restore a snapshot. On the Snapshots tab, select the snapshot whose data you want to restore, and click Restore Snapshot on the form toolbar. This opens the Restore Snapshot dialog box. Click OK in the dialog box to restore the data from the snapshot in the destination tenant and close the dialog box. The operation may take a long time. After the restoration process completes successfully, you are signed out of the system. If the process could not be completed, a red icon appears. To view the description of the problem, move the cursor over the red icon.

Configuring User Roles In Acumatica ERP, you never assign access rights to individual users, instead it uses roles to restrict access to the system. You assign users one role or multiple roles, and based on these assignments, the users are then granted the appropriate access rights to system objects. The topics of this chapter explain details about configuring user access in Acumatica ERP. In Acumatica ERP, you never assign access rights to individual users, instead it uses roles to restrict access to the system. You assign users one role or multiple roles, and based on these assignments, the users are then granted the appropriate access rights to system objects. {br}
The topics of this chapter explain details about configuring user access in Acumatica ERP. ==In This Chapter== *[HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_GeneralInfo|User Roles: General Information] *:User roles in Acumatica ERP are sets of access rights to system objects designed for convenient management of access for users with similar responsibilities in the system. In Acumatica ERP, a system object to which access rights can be set up can be a particular form, container of form elements, form element, or wiki. *[HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_Planning_Concept|User Roles: Planning Access Configuration] *:Designing a system security requires a thorough planning and preparation. User access configuration should support business processes without exposing the company to undue risks. That is, a user should have only the access rights necessary to perform typical tasks, that are clearly stated in the job description of the user. *[HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_Access_Levels|User Roles: Restriction Level Options] *:Users are assigned to roles, and you give these roles the appropriate access rights to system objects— forms, containers of form elements, form elements, and wikis. By defining access rights for a system object you set restriction level a user will have for this object. With Acumatica ERP, you can control access down to the control of form elements, such as buttons, text boxes, and check boxes. *[HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_User_Access_Level_Calculation|User Roles: Calculation of Restriction Level for a User] *:In this topic you will learn how the system calculates a restriction level to a system object for a user with multiple roles assigned. *[HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_Built_In_Roles|User Roles: Predefined Roles] *:For ease of defining and administering roles, Acumatica ERP provides a set of predefined roles that are stored in the System tenant (for details, see [HelpRoot_Administration\SM__con_Support_of_Multiple_Companies|Support of Multiple Tenants]). Predefined roles are always supplied with the system and cannot be deleted. *[HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_User_Access_Business_Date_Change|User Roles: Restrictions on Changing the Business Date] *:In Acumatica ERP, the business date is displayed in the info area. The business date is the date that the system will insert by default into the records that you add to the system. By default, the current date is set as the business date. *[HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_Config_Prereq|User Roles: Configuration Prerequisites] *:Before starting to create user roles, you must be sure that the system has been configured properly and that all required entities have been created, as described in the following sections. *[HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_Implem_Activity|User Roles: To Configure Roles for Four Access Tiers] *:In the following activity, you will learn how to create a user role and specify access rights to system objects for the role. *[HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_To_Configure_Granular_Role|User Roles: To Configure Role with Granular Access] *:In the following activity, you will learn how to create a role with granular access to a system object. *[HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_To_Modify_Role_Copy|User Roles: To Modify Access Rights for a Copied Role] *:In the following activity, you will learn how to copy an existing role and modify copied role access to system objects.

User Roles: General Information User roles in Acumatica ERP are sets of access rights to system objects designed for convenient management of access for users with similar responsibilities in the system. In Acumatica ERP, a system object to which access rights can be set up can be a particular form, container of form elements, form element, or wiki. For details about managing access to wikis, see Wiki Access Management. Learning Objectives In this chapter, you will learn how to do the following: Create a user role and specify access rights to system objects for this role Modify access rights to system objects for a copy of an existing role Give access to only several forms in the system and revoke access to all other system objects. Review access rights a role has to system objects Applicable Scenarios You create or modify user roles in the following cases: When you, as a implementation consultant, initially implement Acumatica ERP for your client and the predefined set of roles does not suite your client needs. When you, as a system administrator, was notified that a security policy of your company has changed and after revision of the current set of roles, you need to modify access rights to Acumatica ERP elements. When you, as a system administrator, was notified about opening a new position in your company, for which the current set of roles does not cover the job description. Restriction Levels A user role in Acumatica ERP is a set of access rights to system objects. By defining access rights for a system object you set a restriction level a user with the role will have for this object. The restriction level defines set of operations a user may perform with the object. The highest restriction level allows a user to perform any operation with an object up to its deletion and the lowest denies access to an object. The system objects are a particular form, container of form elements, form element. In Acumatica ERP, the system objects are grouped in a tree with nodes, where a tenant is the first-level node with the workspaces nested under it. Each workspace, in it is turn, can nest multiple forms, that nest containers of form elements, that nest form elements. Acumatica ERP has the Not Set restriction level that is specific for the system. The Not Set restriction level indicates that all roles have access to a form including its nested objects until at least one role is assigned any other restriction level to this form. All roles with the Not Set level are then denied access to the form. For example, you created a new generic inquiry and added it to a workspace. By default, all roles in the system will get the Not Set restriction level to the inquiry. If you change the level to any other for at least on role, users that are not assigned with this role will not have access to the inquiry. The set of restriction levels available for the system objects depends on the object type. For some objects, you can specify more granular level, for others either allow or deny the access. For details, see User Roles: Restriction Level Options. Access Propagation and Inheritance In Acumatica ERP, the system objects are grouped in a tree with nodes. Each node is a system object that can nest other objects. Access rights either propagated to the nested objects or nested objects inherit access rights from their parents. The hierarchy of nesting is the following: Tenant : A tenant node nests all workspaces configured in the system. The system propagates access rights set to a role for this node to all workspaces in the tenant. Workspace : A workspace node nests all forms added to the workspace. The system propagates access rights set to a role for this node to all forms within the workspace. Form : A form node may or may not nest several containers with the form elements. Nested containers inherit access rights set to a role for a form. Form container : A container node nests form elements, such as boxes and actions. Nested elements inherit access rights set to a role for a container. Form element : An element node is on the lowest level of objects hierarchy and inherits access rights from its parent container. The propagation and inheritance mechanism allows saving time and simplifies setting of access rights to system objects. You can change propagated or inherited rights for any object anytime, that is, change a restriction level received from a parent object. For specifics about restriction levels of a particular system object, see User Roles: Restriction Level Options. Predefined Roles For ease of defining and administering roles, Acumatica ERP provides a set of predefined roles, which is expanded with every major release of Acumatica ERP. Predefined roles are always supplied with the system and cannot be deleted. We recommend using the predefined roles, while setting user access to the system during implementation. Create a new role, only if there is no a predefined role that suites your needs. For details on available predefined roles, see User Roles: Predefined Roles. If a predefined role mostly works for you, but needs a bit of tweaking, we recommend copying the role and do needed changes. Otherwise, all your changes will be deleted during an upgrade. Role Planning Organizations have different kinds of valuable information that needs protecting, like financial documents, customer and vendor information. Different employees need access to different subsets of this information to perform their duties. Before you start planning the set of user roles, we recommend to make sure that job roles and responsibilities in your company are clearly defined. The job responsibilities of a user define access to forms, records, and operations on the records. While planning the set of roles, take into account objectives of internal control procedures implemented in your company, like preventing and detecting fraud, completeness and accuracy of financial records, safeguarding assets, timely preparation of financial statements. For example, to minimize the risk of errors and fraud, duties associated with cash handling are often segregated. Also, segregation is recommended for duties related to documents recording and further processing, as well as conducting reconciliations and preparing financial statements. We highly recommend performing planning of access configuration when the system is initially implemented and in case of changing a security policy of an organization. For detailed recommendations, see User Roles: Planning Access Configuration. Role Creation You use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201005|SM201005]) User Roles (SM201005) form to create a role. By default, a newly created role has the Not Set restriction level for all system objects. The nested objects (containers and elements) have the Inherited access level. We recommend using some naming conventions for the user roles that you create or copy from predefined roles. As Acumatica ERP is supplied with the set of predefined roles, for which access rights were set up (that is, restriction levels to different objects were changed from Not Set to restriction level appropriate for a role), a newly created role will be denied access to most system objects. The Not Set restriction level indicates that all roles have access to a form including its nested objects until at least one role is assigned any other restriction level to this form. This role can be any role in the system. All roles with the Not Set level are then denied access to the form. To set up access rights to multiple system objects for multiple roles, you use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201020|SM201020]) Access Rights by Screen (SM201020) form. The form allows you to see restriction level that other roles have to a system object. This information can be useful when you set up access to this object to a particular role as it may affect access of other roles, if the Not Set restriction level is specified for them. To set up access rights to multiple system objects for an individual role, you use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201025|SM201025]) Access Rights by Role (SM201025) form. The process of defining task-based roles requires in-depth knowledge of both the organization's business processes and the Acumatica ERP approach to security. Role Access Modification During ongoing maintenance of Acumatica ERP, you may have tasks to change users' access rights to some system objects. To modify a role access you use either the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201020|SM201020]) Access Rights by Screen or ([~/?ScreenId=SM201025|SM201025]) Access Rights by Role form. You may take different approaches in configuring user access: assigning a user with a single role or with a combination of roles. This may affect how a role modification will affect an individual user access. If you do not use role combination the modification of a role will affect access for all users with the role assigned. If you use role combination the modification of a role may differently affect users with the role assigned. For details, see User Roles: Calculation of Restriction Level for a User. Before proceeding to role modification, we recommend collecting detailed information about the role configuration and users assigned with the role. For details on access management reports, see User Access: Related Report and Inquiry Forms.

User Roles: Planning Access Configuration Designing a system security requires a thorough planning and preparation. User access configuration should support business processes without exposing the company to undue risks. That is, a user should have only the access rights necessary to perform typical tasks, that are clearly stated in the job description of the user. In this topic you will read about approaches we recommend you to consider while planning user access to the system. Full Access Role Approach Small companies usually do not require a complex user access configuration that includes multiple roles and strict segregation by job responsibilities. Employees are usually multitasking and restricting access to the system configuration is usually enough. In this case, you can design roles individually for a person or for a group of people. For example, for a company with 5 to 10 employees, you can configure two roles as follows: Administrator : Users with this role have complete access to all system objects in the system regardless functional area. Regular User : Users with this role have complete access to system objects of multiple functional areas, except for areas related to the system security and user management. Access Tier Approach Midsized companies need more complex user access configuration as more people need to access company's data, but job responsibilities usually are defined and segregated more clearly. Let's consider the predefined set of roles that regulates access to finance-related functionality. Roles are grouped by functional areas, such as general ledger, accounts payables, accounts receivables and others. Across these areas, we can say that in this set there are three tiers of access for each functional area: Admin, Clerk, and Viewer. The following table summarizes the access difference for these tiers. Access Tier Adding and Processing Records Deleting Records Configuration Settings Reports and Inquiries Admin Full access Full access Full access Full access Clerk Full access Full access View only View only Viewer View only View only View only View only With such configuration you might consider giving to a user a set of roles either from the Clerk or Admin tiers and use roles from the Viewer tier for employees who perform internal or external audit. For example, you assign to a senior accountant all roles from the Admin tier, thus giving complete access to the whole finance-related functionality. For the accountant assistants you assign roles from the Clerk tier according to their responsibilities. Also, you might consider combination of roles from different tiers. For example, a user who is doing reconciliation will need to view reports and inquiries from general ledger and accounts payable functional areas. So, in addition to CA Admin role that allows doing reconciliation, you assign to the user the AP Viewer and GL Viewer roles. Granular Role Approach Aside having three tiers of access (Admin, Clerk, and Viewer), we recommend creating roles that allows performing granular, but sensitive tasks. For example, suppose that a senior accountant with a role from the Admin tier usually reprints checks. During their vacation the senior accountant passed this responsibility to their deputy who has a role from the Clerk tier. If you have a role that allows performing only reprinting checks, you can temporary assign this role to the deputy user, instead of giving a role from the Admin tier. The other solution for securing access to reprinting checks is to create a role specifically for reprinting checks and restrict access to reprinting for all other roles. In this case, you can assign this role to only approved users regardless their tier of access.

User Roles: Restriction Level Options Users are assigned to roles, and you give these roles the appropriate access rights to system objects— forms, containers of form elements, form elements, and wikis. By defining access rights for a system object you set restriction level a user will have for this object. With Acumatica ERP, you can control access down to the control of form elements, such as buttons, text boxes, and check boxes. This topic describes the restriction levels available to different system objects. Access to a Workspace In Acumatica ERP, you do not set up access to a particular workspace itself. Instead, by setting access rights (that is restriction level) for a workspace, you set up access for all the nested objects. If you change the access rights to any nested object of a workspace, the system will change the access rights to Multiple Rights at the workspace level. The system displays a workspace with Multiple Rights in the main menu. On the workspace dashboard, the system displays only forms for which access is not restricted for a particular user. Keep in mind that a form may belong to multiple workspaces. If you set access to one of these workspaces (that is, to all forms in the workspace), the system will assign to a form that belongs to multiple workspaces the restriction level set most recently for one of these workspaces. The system will then change the access for other workspaces to which the form belongs to the Multiple Rights option, if these workspaces had a different access rights. For example, the ([~/?ScreenId=AP402000|AP402000]) Vendor Details form can be accessed from the Payables and Purchases workspaces. Both workspaces have the Granted restriction level for the Purchasing role. You change the level for the form under the Payables workspace to Revoked . The system displays the new level for the form under the Purchases workspace and changes access to Multiple Rights for both workspaces. The following table summarizes the restriction levels that roles can have to all forms that belong to a particular workspace of Acumatica ERP. Restriction Level Description Multiple Rights Means that a role has different restriction levels to the nested objects of a workspace. If you change the level for the workspace, the system will automatically apply the new level to all nested objects. Not Set Allows all roles to have access to all forms in a workspace until Revoked or Granted level is set to the workspace for at least one role. After that, a role with the Not Set level is denied access to the forms in the workspace. Revoked Denies the role access to all the forms in a workspace. That is, all forms will get the Revoked restriction level. For users with the role, the workspace and its forms do not appear in the main menu. Granted Allows the role complete access to all the forms in a workspace. That is, all forms will get the Delete restriction level. You can, however, limit or revoke access to particular forms within the workspace for the role. In this case, the system will change the access rights for the workspace to Multiple Rights . You can set up access rights to individual forms in the Hidden node (which cannot be accessed from the main menu), but not to the node itself. Access to Reports and Generic Inquiries A workspace may include multiple reports and inquiries along with the Acumatica ERP forms. Available restriction levels depend on tools used to develop a report or an inquiry. Reports built with the Report Designer application and inquiries created using the ([~/?ScreenId=SM208000|SM208000]) Generic Inquiry form have the same list of available restriction levels that roles can have to workspaces. Reports built with the Analytical Report Manager toolkit and inquires developed using C# have the same list of available restriction levels that roles can have to forms. Access to a Form Within each workspace, you can set the access rights that roles have to Acumatica ERP forms, which affects what users with those roles can access. The restriction level to the form is inherited by the entities and records that can be created by using the form. Restriction Level Description Not Set When assigned to all roles, allows all roles to have access to the form until the restriction level is changed to any other level for at least one role. After at least one role has been assigned another level, access to the form is denied for a role with the Not Set level. Revoked Denies the role access to the form and its functionality. View Only Gives the role restricted access to the form and its functionality. This level allows users with the role to view the form and any records associated with the form (in drop-down lists on other forms). This level forbids users with the role to edit details about any record, create new records or entities of the type, and delete records. Edit Gives the role restricted access to the form and its functionality. This level allows users with the role to view the form, select records, and edit details about any record. This level forbids users with the role to create new records or entities of the type, and to delete records. The Clipboard button is available on the form toolbar for users with the role. Insert Gives the role restricted access to the form and its functionality. This level allows users with the role to view the form, select records, edit details about any record, and create new records or entities of the type. This level forbids users with the role to delete records. The Clipboard and Insert buttons are available on the form toolbar for users with the role. Delete Gives the role complete access to the form and its functionality. This level encompasses the capabilities of the View Only , Edit , and Insert levels, while also giving users with the role the ability to delete records. For users with the role, the Clipboard , Insert , and Delete buttons are available on the form toolbar. Access to Containers of Form Elements Each form includes containers of elements, such as nested forms, tabs, and grids. Each container includes multiple elements and actions. You can restrict access to any of these containers on the form. The restriction level a role has to the container is inherited by the entities and records created by using the container, if applicable. For example, if you permit access for a user role to a grid, a user with this role can access all records in this grid. By default, containers inherit restriction level from the form to which they belong. Restriction Level Description Inherited Indicates that the role's access to the container was not explicitly specified and is inherited from its form. Revoked Denies the role access to the container and hides it from the form for users with the role. These users will not see the container on the form. View Only Gives the role restricted access to the container and its functionality. This level allows users with the role to view the container and any records associated with the container (in drop-down lists on other forms), if applicable. The level forbids users with the role to edit details about any record, create new records or entities of the type, and delete records, if applicable. Edit Gives users with the role restricted access to the container and its functionality. This level allows users with the role to view the container, select records, and edit details about any record, if applicable. The level forbids users with the role to create new records or entities of the type, and delete records, if applicable. Insert Gives the role restricted access to the container and its functionality. This level allows users with the role to view the container, select records, edit details about any record, and create new records or entities of the type, if applicable. This level forbids users with the role to delete records, if applicable. Delete Gives the role complete access to the container and its functionality. This level encompasses the capabilities of the View Only , Edit , and Insert levels, while also giving users with the role the ability to delete records, if applicable. Access to Form Elements By default, the restriction level a role has to the form elements and actions is inherited from the container of form elements to which elements and actions belong. In most cases, a restriction level for a container is not explicitly specified and is set to Inherited . Thus, before changing a restriction level to an element or an action you should explicitly specify a restriction level for the parent container. Then you can set access to the form elements and actions. Restriction Level Description Inherited Indicates that the role's access to the element was not explicitly specified and is inherited from its container of form elements. Revoked Denies the role access to the element and hides the element. A user with the role will not see the element on the form. View Only Makes the element read-only for users with the role. A user with the role will see the element on the form but will not be able to use it. Edit Allows the use of the element for users with the role.

In this topic you will learn how the system calculates a restriction level to a system object for a user with multiple roles assigned.[anchor|#_2708bbea-95b1-4a47-8cc5-3bbcb3dc961f] ==Calculation of Restriction Level to Forms== If a user has multiple roles assigned and the roles have different restriction levels to the system object, the following general rule is used: Acumatica ERP applies the most permissive level among the roles. For example, suppose that a user is assigned the Employee and Sales Manager roles. The Employee role has the ''Revoked'' restriction level for the '''Inventory''' workspace node, and the Sales Manager role has the ''Granted'' level for the same node. With these settings, the user has the ''Granted'' level to the forms in the '''Inventory''' workspace. See, the table below for illustration of the example.[anchor|#_37bce6d3-a52c-4394-af9b-06c7af96dbab] ===Calculation of final restriction level to forms of a workspace=== {| class="checklist" | width="100%" |- !width="33%" ! User Role !width="33%" ! Restriction Level !width="33%" ! Final Level to Form for User |- | Employee | ''Revoked'' | rowspan="2" | ''Granted'' |- | Sales Manager | ''Granted'' |}[anchor|#_02c90f1a-d2f1-4576-97cf-bdf10a115a0f]((({S:Danger}The ''Not Set'' restriction level indicates that all roles have access to a form including its nested objects until at least one role is assigned any other restriction level to this form. This role can be any role in the system. All roles with the ''Not Set'' level are then denied access to the form. ))) ==Calculation of Restriction Level to Form Nested Objects with Inherited Level== If all roles have the ''Inherited'' restriction level to the particular form element container or form element, the resulting level is the most permissive level of the system object at the next highest level—the form (for a form element container) or the form element container (for a form element). Suppose that a user is assigned the Employee and the Accountant user roles. The Employee role has the ''Revoked'' restriction level to the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AR_30_30_00|Customers] ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) form, and the Accountant role has the ''Edit'' level to this form. The default restriction level both roles have to the form elements is ''Inherited''. The user with these roles, then, has the ''Edit'' access level to the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AR_30_30_00|Customers] form and its elements. See, the following table for illustration of the example.[anchor|#_f009b64c-dbfa-4959-8f08-ea0732d0ca9b] ===Calculation of final restriction level to nested objects with Inherited level=== {| class="checklist" | width="100%" |- !width="25%" ! User Role !width="25%" ! Restriction Level to Form !width="25%" ! Restriction Level to Form Nested Objects !width="25%" ! Final Level to Form and its Nested Objects for User |- | Employee | ''Revoked'' | ''Inherited'' | rowspan="2" | ''Edit'' |- | Accountant | ''Edit'' | ''Inherited'' |} ==Calculation of Restriction Level to Form Nested Objects with Specified Level== If you have explicitly specified a restriction level to the particular form element container or form element for at least one role, while the other roles have the ''Inherited'' level to this system object, then the resulting level of access rights is the most permissive among only the roles with explicitly defined restriction levels. The system ignores the roles with the ''Inherited'' level of access rights. This algorithm is used to optimize the speed of loading the form. {br}
Suppose that a user is assigned the Employee, Warehouse Worker, and Sales Assistant user roles. All these roles have the ''Insert'' restriction level to the [HelpRoot_FormReference\IN_30_10_00|Receipts] ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) form. The ''Employee'' role has the ''Inherited'' restriction level to the '''Release''' button on this form, the ''Warehouse Worker'' role has the ''Revoked'' level to this button, and the ''Sales Assistant'' role has the ''View Only'' level to this button. As a result, the user has the ''View Only'' restriction level (the most permissive level of the two explicitly defined levels) to this button. See, the following table for illustration of the example.[anchor|#_afc009f3-005f-4dbd-95a9-f56bb3bec299] ===Calculation of final restriction level to nested objects with specified level=== {| class="checklist" | width="100%" |- !width="25%" ! User Roles !width="25%" ! Restriction Level to Form !width="25%" ! Restriction Level to a Nested Object !width="25%" ! Final Level to the Nested Object for User |- | Employee | ''Insert'' | ''Inherited'' | rowspan="3" | ''View Only'' |- | Warehouse Worker | ''Insert'' | ''Revoked'' |- | Sales Assistant | ''Insert'' | ''View Only'' |}

For ease of defining and administering roles, Acumatica ERP provides a set of predefined roles that are stored in the System tenant (for details, see [HelpRoot_Administration\SM__con_Support_of_Multiple_Companies|Support of Multiple Tenants]). Predefined roles are always supplied with the system and cannot be deleted. {br}
Some of these roles grant the users access to a specific functionality, and some of the roles are used by the system and should not be assigned to users manually. ==Service Roles== The following service roles are available in the system:[anchor|#_adf47f0a-e38d-4561-afc0-637f451bd353] *''AcumaticaSupport'': The role is reserved for the predefined ''AcumaticaSupport'' user, that is used to provide access for support engineers to a tenant. *''Anonymous'': This role is reserved for system use. *''DashboardDesigner'': The system automatically designates this role as a dashboard owner role for dashboards that were created in previous versions of Acumatica ERP. We recommend that you create specific roles for users who should own particular dashboards. For details, see [HelpRoot_ReportingTools\Administering_Dashboards_Mapref|Managing Dashboards]. *''Guest'': This role is used for backward compatibility.
==Administrative Roles== The following administrative roles are available in the system:[anchor|#_b42ea6d8-0b98-4d60-8486-7799bcc5af79] *''Administrator'': A user with this role has full access to all system objects, and any access restrictions to system objects are not applied to this role. Therefore we recommend that you assign users to this role only during initial system setup so they can define roles and enter users. Then assign the role only in extraordinary cases. We recommend that you create a user role for system administrators with access only to Acumatica ERP forms that are used for configuration and management of the system. *:((({S:Hint}When you add a new form to the site map, for example a generic inquiry, we strongly recommend to set the ''Granted'' level to this form for this role. ))) *:((({S:Warn}A user with this role cannot publish reports and modify original dashboards (which have an owner role other than ''Administrator''). ))) *''BI'': A user with this role can access the ''BI Views''—that is, the generic inquiries that are exposed through the OData protocol (the '''Expose via OData''' check box is selected for the inquiry on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_80_00|Generic Inquiry] ([~/?ScreenId=SM208000|SM208000]) form). For more information, see [HelpRoot_ReportingTools\GI_Exposing_Inquiry_by_Using_OData_Mapref|Exposing an Inquiry by Using OData]. *''BusinessDateOverride'': A user with this role can change the business date in the info area of Acumatica ERP. This role appears only if the ''Secure Business Date'' feature is enabled on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form. For details, see [HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_User_Access_Business_Date_Change|User Roles: Restrictions on Changing the Business Date]. *''Customizer'': A user with this role can customize Acumatica ERP applications. For details, see [HelpRoot_Dev_Customization\CG_GL_Stages_Role|To Assign the Customizer Role to a User Account]. *''CS Admin'': Users with this role can access system functions and configuration entities that might be needed by users in financial positions. More specifically, they have administrative permissions to configure most of the common settings, including segmented keys, numbering sequences, tasks, and business process scenarios, as well as to manage business events, notification templates, and document templates. Users with the ''CS Admin'' role also have full access to row-level security settings and most of the integration functions. *''Data Privacy Controller'': A user with this role has access to the compliance tools for General Data Protection Regulation. For details, see [HelpRoot_Administration\GD__MNG_Handling_Personal_Data|Handling Personal Data]. *''Field-Level Audit'': A user with this role can view the audit trail directly from an audited form. For details, see [HelpRoot_Administration\SM__mng_FieldLevel_audit|Managing Field-Level Auditing]. *''OData4 User'': A user with this role can access data exposed through the OData protocol version 4. *''ReportDesigner'': A user with this role can publish reports in Acumatica ERP. Any user can create reports in Report Designer, but for publishing reports in Acumatica ERP, the user needs to be granted this role. *''Wiki Admin'': A user with this role can set other users’ access rights to wikis. For details, see [HelpRoot_Administration\SM__con_Wiki_Access_Setup|Wiki Access Management]. *''Wiki Author'': A user with this role can create wiki articles. For details, see [HelpRoot_Administration\SM__con_Wiki_Access_Setup|Wiki Access Management].
==User Profile-Related Roles== The following roles that manage access to a user personal settings are available in the system:[anchor|#_aa1370f7-80de-4ab6-8898-20ef2b099568] *''Internal Employee'': Users with this role have full access to personal settings, tasks, events, email, and time cards, as well as expense receipts and claims. Additionally, these users can view Help. *''Internal User'': A user with this role can change personal settings, and view Help. It is automatically assigned to all user accounts linked with the ''Employee'' user type.
==CRM-Related Roles== The following roles that manage access to CRM functionality are available in the system:[anchor|#_404caa74-9be7-434c-919c-f072977adc51] *''CR Marketing Manager'': A user with this role has access to marketing functions and settings. *''CR Sales & Marketing Admin'': A user with this role has full access to sales and marketing functions and settings. *''CR Sales Representative'': A user with this role has access to sales functions and settings. *''CR Support Admin'': A user with this role has full access to support functions and settings. *''CR Support Representative'': A user with this role has access to support functions and settings. *''CR Viewer'': A user with this role has read-only access to marketing, sales, and support functions and settings.
==Finance-Related Roles== The following roles that manage access to finance functionality are available in the system:[anchor|#ul_bgy_lrm_gk] *''AP Admin'': A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to accounts payable as well as read-only access to general ledger transactions. *''AP Clerk'': A user with this role has access to accounts payable functions, as well as read-only access to accounts payable settings and general ledger transactions. *''AP Viewer'': A user with this role has read-only access to accounts payable functions. *''AR Admin'': A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to accounts receivable as well as read-only access to general ledger transactions. *''AR Clerk'': A user with this role has access to accounts receivable functions as well as read-only access to accounts receivable settings and general ledger transactions. *''AR Viewer'': A user with this role has read-only access to accounts receivable functions. *''CA Admin'': A user with this role has access to cash management functions and settings. *''CA Clerk'': A user with this role has access to cash management functions and read-only access to cash management settings. *''CA Viewer'': A user with this role has read-only access to cash management functions. *''CM Admin'': A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to currency management. *''CM Viewer'': A user with this role has read-only access to currency management functions. *''DR Admin'': A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to deferred revenue. *''DR Viewer'': A user with this role has read-only access to deferred revenue functions. *''FA Admin'': A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to fixed assets. *''FA Clerk'': A user with this role has access to fixed asset functions, as well as read-only access to fixed asset settings. *''FA Viewer'': A user with this role has read-only access to fixed asset functions. *''Financial Supervisor'': A user with this role can post to closed financial periods, while all other users are not able to work with these periods (when the '''Restrict Access to Closed Periods''' check box is selected on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\GL_10_20_00|General Ledger Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=GL102000|GL102000]) form). A financial supervisor can also reopen ''Closed'' periods and unlock ''Locked'' periods. *''GL Admin'': A user with this role has access to functions and settings related with the general ledger. *''GL Clerk'': A user with this role has access to general ledger functions, as well as read-only access to general ledger settings. *''GL Viewer'': A user with this role has read-only access to general ledger functions. *''Project Accountant'': A user with this role can upload and process GL and PM transactions for project tasks with the ''Completed'', ''Canceled'', or ''In Planning'' status, while all other users are not able to process transactions for such project tasks. *''TX Admin'': A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to taxes. *''TX Viewer'': A user with this role has read-only access to tax-related functions.
==Payroll-Related Roles==[anchor|#_90f40786-8161-43d0-8eda-31a8dbfc5761] *''PR Admin'': A user with this role has full access to payroll functions and settings, and read-only access to banking, payables, projects, finance, and configuration settings. *''PR Clerk'': A user with this role has limited access to payroll functions, such as data entry and internal reporting, read-only access to payroll settings, and read-only access to banking, payables, projects, finance, and configuration settings. *''PR Manager'': A user with this role has full access to payroll functions, read-only access to payroll settings, and read-only access to banking, payables, projects, finance, and configuration settings. *''PR Viewer'': A user with this role has read-only access to payroll functions.
==Self-Service Portal-Related Roles== The following roles that manage access to Acumatica Self-Service Portal are available in the system:[anchor|#_2abfd6a1-665d-4059-8337-b7086e333d5b] *''Guest'': This role is used for backward compatibility. *''Internal Employee'': Users with this role have full access to personal settings, tasks, events, email, and time cards, as well as expense receipts and claims. Additionally, these users can view Help, and also they have read-only access to payroll inquiries. *''Internal User'': A user with this role can change personal settings, and view Help. Also, these users have read-only access to payroll inquiries, such as personal pay stubs. This role is automatically assigned to all user accounts linked with the ''Employee'' user type. *''Portal Admin'': A user with this role can access the Acumatica Self-Service Portal configuration forms and configure Self-Service Portal. For more information about Acumatica Self-Service Portal, see [HelpRoot_SS_Portal_Admin\SP_SP_00_00| Self-Service Portal]. *''Portal User'': A user with this role can access Self-Service Portal. You should assign this role only to contacts who must have access to Self-Service Portal. For more information about Acumatica Self-Service Portal, see [HelpRoot_SS_Portal_Admin\SP_SP_00_00| Self-Service Portal].

User Roles: Predefined Roles For ease of defining and administering roles, Acumatica ERP provides a set of predefined roles that are stored in the System tenant (for details, see Support of Multiple Tenants). Predefined roles are always supplied with the system and cannot be deleted. Some of these roles grant the users access to a specific functionality, and some of the roles are used by the system and should not be assigned to users manually. Service Roles The following service roles are available in the system: AcumaticaSupport : The role is reserved for the predefined AcumaticaSupport user, that is used to provide access for support engineers to a tenant. Anonymous : This role is reserved for system use. DashboardDesigner : The system automatically designates this role as a dashboard owner role for dashboards that were created in previous versions of Acumatica ERP. We recommend that you create specific roles for users who should own particular dashboards. For details, see Managing Dashboards. Guest : This role is used for backward compatibility. Administrative Roles The following administrative roles are available in the system: Administrator : A user with this role has full access to all system objects, and any access restrictions to system objects are not applied to this role. Therefore we recommend that you assign users to this role only during initial system setup so they can define roles and enter users. Then assign the role only in extraordinary cases. We recommend that you create a user role for system administrators with access only to Acumatica ERP forms that are used for configuration and management of the system. When you add a new form to the site map, for example a generic inquiry, we strongly recommend to set the Granted level to this form for this role. A user with this role cannot publish reports and modify original dashboards (which have an owner role other than Administrator ). BI : A user with this role can access the BI Views —that is, the generic inquiries that are exposed through the OData protocol (the Expose via OData check box is selected for the inquiry on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM208000|SM208000]) Generic Inquiry (SM208000) form). For more information, see Exposing an Inquiry by Using OData. BusinessDateOverride : A user with this role can change the business date in the info area of Acumatica ERP. This role appears only if the Secure Business Date feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. For details, see User Roles: Restrictions on Changing the Business Date. Customizer : A user with this role can customize Acumatica ERP applications. For details, see To Assign the Customizer Role to a User Account. CS Admin : Users with this role can access system functions and configuration entities that might be needed by users in financial positions. More specifically, they have administrative permissions to configure most of the common settings, including segmented keys, numbering sequences, tasks, and business process scenarios, as well as to manage business events, notification templates, and document templates. Users with the CS Admin role also have full access to row-level security settings and most of the integration functions. Data Privacy Controller : A user with this role has access to the compliance tools for General Data Protection Regulation. For details, see Handling Personal Data. Field-Level Audit : A user with this role can view the audit trail directly from an audited form. For details, see Managing Field-Level Auditing. OData4 User : A user with this role can access data exposed through the OData protocol version 4. ReportDesigner : A user with this role can publish reports in Acumatica ERP. Any user can create reports in Report Designer, but for publishing reports in Acumatica ERP, the user needs to be granted this role. Wiki Admin : A user with this role can set other users' access rights to wikis. For details, see Wiki Access Management. Wiki Author : A user with this role can create wiki articles. For details, see Wiki Access Management. User Profile-Related Roles The following roles that manage access to a user personal settings are available in the system: Internal Employee : Users with this role have full access to personal settings, tasks, events, email, and time cards, as well as expense receipts and claims. Additionally, these users can view Help. Internal User : A user with this role can change personal settings, and view Help. It is automatically assigned to all user accounts linked with the Employee user type. CRM-Related Roles The following roles that manage access to CRM functionality are available in the system: CR Marketing Manager : A user with this role has access to marketing functions and settings. CR Sales & Marketing Admin : A user with this role has full access to sales and marketing functions and settings. CR Sales Representative : A user with this role has access to sales functions and settings. CR Support Admin : A user with this role has full access to support functions and settings. CR Support Representative : A user with this role has access to support functions and settings. CR Viewer : A user with this role has read-only access to marketing, sales, and support functions and settings. Finance-Related Roles The following roles that manage access to finance functionality are available in the system: AP Admin : A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to accounts payable as well as read-only access to general ledger transactions. AP Clerk : A user with this role has access to accounts payable functions, as well as read-only access to accounts payable settings and general ledger transactions. AP Viewer : A user with this role has read-only access to accounts payable functions. AR Admin : A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to accounts receivable as well as read-only access to general ledger transactions. AR Clerk : A user with this role has access to accounts receivable functions as well as read-only access to accounts receivable settings and general ledger transactions. AR Viewer : A user with this role has read-only access to accounts receivable functions. CA Admin : A user with this role has access to cash management functions and settings. CA Clerk : A user with this role has access to cash management functions and read-only access to cash management settings. CA Viewer : A user with this role has read-only access to cash management functions. CM Admin : A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to currency management. CM Viewer : A user with this role has read-only access to currency management functions. DR Admin : A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to deferred revenue. DR Viewer : A user with this role has read-only access to deferred revenue functions. FA Admin : A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to fixed assets. FA Clerk : A user with this role has access to fixed asset functions, as well as read-only access to fixed asset settings. FA Viewer : A user with this role has read-only access to fixed asset functions. Financial Supervisor : A user with this role can post to closed financial periods, while all other users are not able to work with these periods (when the Restrict Access to Closed Periods check box is selected on the ([~/?ScreenId=GL102000|GL102000]) General Ledger Preferences (GL102000) form). A financial supervisor can also reopen Closed periods and unlock Locked periods. GL Admin : A user with this role has access to functions and settings related with the general ledger. GL Clerk : A user with this role has access to general ledger functions, as well as read-only access to general ledger settings. GL Viewer : A user with this role has read-only access to general ledger functions. Project Accountant : A user with this role can upload and process GL and PM transactions for project tasks with the Completed , Canceled , or In Planning status, while all other users are not able to process transactions for such project tasks. TX Admin : A user with this role has access to functions and settings related to taxes. TX Viewer : A user with this role has read-only access to tax-related functions. Payroll-Related Roles PR Admin : A user with this role has full access to payroll functions and settings, and read-only access to banking, payables, projects, finance, and configuration settings. PR Clerk : A user with this role has limited access to payroll functions, such as data entry and internal reporting, read-only access to payroll settings, and read-only access to banking, payables, projects, finance, and configuration settings. PR Manager : A user with this role has full access to payroll functions, read-only access to payroll settings, and read-only access to banking, payables, projects, finance, and configuration settings. PR Viewer : A user with this role has read-only access to payroll functions. Self-Service Portal-Related Roles The following roles that manage access to Acumatica Self-Service Portal are available in the system: Guest : This role is used for backward compatibility. Internal Employee : Users with this role have full access to personal settings, tasks, events, email, and time cards, as well as expense receipts and claims. Additionally, these users can view Help, and also they have read-only access to payroll inquiries. Internal User : A user with this role can change personal settings, and view Help. Also, these users have read-only access to payroll inquiries, such as personal pay stubs. This role is automatically assigned to all user accounts linked with the Employee user type. Portal Admin : A user with this role can access the Acumatica Self-Service Portal configuration forms and configure Self-Service Portal. For more information about Acumatica Self-Service Portal, see Self-Service Portal. Portal User : A user with this role can access Self-Service Portal. You should assign this role only to contacts who must have access to Self-Service Portal. For more information about Acumatica Self-Service Portal, see Self-Service Portal.

User Roles: Restrictions on Changing the Business Date In Acumatica ERP, the business date is displayed in the info area. The business date is the date that the system will insert by default into the records that you add to the system. By default, the current date is set as the business date. Some companies might want to restrict the availability of changing the business date in the system. This can be done to avoid issues with generated documents that have the dates of closed periods inserted into them. By default, all users can change the business date in the Acumatica ERP system. Configuring Permissions to Change the Business Date To restrict the availability to change the business date, you should enable the Secure Business Date feature on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form. This will make the Business Date menu button generally unavailable for clicking and editing. In your company, only some employees might need the ability to change the business date in the system. You can grant these users access rights to change it by assigning the BusinessDateOverride role to them on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201010|SM201010]) Users (SM201010) form or the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201005|SM201005]) User Roles (SM201005) form. This role is available only if the Secure Business Date feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Incrementing of the Business Date The system handles the incrementing of the business date at midnight individually for each user session: The date is automatically incremented at midnight only if you have not modified the business date in any way during your user session. That is, if you do not change the business date during your user session and your session is active at midnight, the system increments the date. If you have modified the business date somehow, the system will keep the changed date as long as your user session is active.

User Roles: To Configure Roles for Four Access Tiers In the following activity, you will learn how to create a user role and specify access rights to system objects for the role. The following activity is based on the U100 dataset. If you are using another dataset, or if any system settings have been changed in U100 , these changes can affect the workflow of the activity and the results of the processing. To avoid any issues, restore the U100 dataset to its initial state. Story Suppose that the SweetLife Fruits & Jams company has purchased Acumatica ERP subscription in . The instance has been installed by SaaS engineers, and a basic company configuration has been performed. It was decided to have four access tiers: Configurator : Roles from this tier give access only to configuration settings of a functional area. Manager : Roles from this tier allows working with entities, inquiries, and reports of a functional area without any restrictions and view configuration settings. Clerk : Roles from this tier allows only adding new records and edit record details within a functional area. Auditor : Roles from this tier allows only viewing records, inquiries, and reports associated with a functional area. You, as a system administrator, decided to start implementation of the tiers with the general ledger functional area. By default, forms related to this area are grouped under the Finance workspace. Process Overview To configure roles for four access tiers within the general ledger functional area, you first prepare a spreadsheet with the list of forms of the functional area, and mark a category of each form to understand what this form for—configuration, data entry, processing, or reporting. Then you add roles to the list and set restriction level for each role against the form. For this activity we will use the GL_4Tier_Access GL_4Tier_Access spreadsheet that was prepared for training purposes. The GL_4Tier_Access GL_4Tier_Access spreadsheet contains limited set of the forms related to the general ledger functional area and can be used for training purposes only. With the spreadsheet prepared, you use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201005|SM201005]) User Roles (SM201005) form to create four roles. You will use the AA prefix for the roles to have them on top of the list, combined with _GL to indicate the functional area. System Preparation Before you start configuring roles, sign in to a company with the U100 dataset preloaded as a system administrator with the following credentials: Username: gibbs Password: 123 Step 1: Creating Roles To create a role, do the following: Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201005|SM201005]) User Roles (SM201005) form. On the form toolbar, click Add New Record . In the Role Name box, type AA_GL_Configurator . In the Role Description box, type Role to access GL configuration settings . On the form toolbar, click Save . Add three more roles with the following settings: Name : AA_GL_Manager ; Description : Role for working with GL entities and viewing settings Name : AA_GL_Clerk ; Description : Role for entering and editing records Name : AA_GL_Auditor ; Description : Role for viewing records and reports Step 2: Granting Access to All Forms of a Workspace To set access rights to multiple roles, do the following: Open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201020|SM201020]) Access Rights by Screen (SM201020) form. In the left pane of the form, select the Finance node. In the right pane, locate the four roles you have created. Notice, that the roles have the Not Set access rights for all forms within the workspace, as all newly created roles. In the right pane, for the AA_GL_Manager role, in the Access Rights column, select the Granted option. This role is planned to have the highest access level to the most forms. To save time, you grant access to all the forms of the workspace at once. On the form toolbar, click Save . Step 3: Modifying Access to a Form To modify restriction level for a form, do the following: While remaining on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201020|SM201020]) Access Rights by Screen (SM201020) form, in the left pane expand the Finance node, to access the list of the forms. In the left pane, select the first form from the list, which is ([~/?ScreenId=GL402000|GL402000]) Account by Period. In the right pane, for the AA_GL_Auditor role, in the Access Rights column, select the View Only option. According to the GL_4Tier_Access GL_4Tier_Access spreadsheet, that is the restriction level this role should have for this form. Verify that the other three roles have the planned access, that is: AA_GL_Configurator: Not Set AA_GL_Manager: Delete AA_GL_Clerk: Not Set On the form toolbar, click Save . Modify access rights for the rest of the forms, according to the GL_4Tier_Access GL_4Tier_Access spreadsheet. You have created and configured roles for four access tiers within the general ledger functional area.

In the following activity, you will learn how to create a role with granular access to a system object.[anchor|#_c285d68f-cb5f-4985-a428-4427acdf5b5a]((({S:Danger}The following activity is based on the ''U100'' dataset. If you are using another dataset, or if any system settings have been changed in ''U100'', these changes can affect the workflow of the activity and the results of the processing. To avoid any issues, restore the ''U100'' dataset to its initial state. ))) ==Story== Suppose that a CFO of the SweetLife Fruits & Jams company decided that only employees, authorized by CFO are allowed to reprint checks. To accommodate this requirement, you, as a system administrator, decided to create a granular role that will give access to the reprinting checks only and restrict access to this operation to all other roles. As a result, only users that have full access to accounts payable (that is, assigned with a role that gives this access) can be authorized to reprint checks by assigning them this granular role on CFO request. ==Process Overview== You use the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_10_05|User Roles] ([~/?ScreenId=SM201005|SM201005]) form to create the <tt>AA_AP_Reprint_Checks</tt> role. You will use the <tt>AA</tt> prefix for the role to have it on top of the list, combined with <tt>_AP</tt> to indicate the functional area.{br}
You use the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_10_20|Access Rights by Screen] ([~/?ScreenId=SM201020|SM201020]) form to set access to the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_50_52_00|Release Payments] ([~/?ScreenId=AP505200|AP505200]) form that contains the ''Reprint'' and ''Reprint With New Number'' operations. The new role is to be used only in combination with a role that gives full access to the accounts payable functionality, but you cannot configure access to the actions if an explicit restriction level is not specified for the form. Thus, you revoke access to the form for the new role, because you need to allow access only to two elements, access to the other functionality of the form will be provided by the accompanying role.{br}
The You use the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_10_20|Access Rights by Screen] ([~/?ScreenId=SM201020|SM201020]) form to modify access to the ''Reprint'' and ''Reprint With New Number'' operations as follows:[anchor|#_c73e4b43-cce1-4c0d-99bf-386741bf931b] #You determine roles that also have full access to the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_50_52_00|Release Payments] form. You can exclude roles that have the ''Not Set'', ''View Only'', and ''Revoked'' access to the form and then the roles that you are not using for managing user access (for example, predefined roles delivered with Acumatica ERP). In this activity, we assume that the ''Accountant'' and ''Purchase Manager'' roles meet the criteria. That is, these roles are used for user access management and have a restriction level higher than ''View Only''. #:((({S:Hint}To form the list of roles that need modification you can use filters for the table columns in the right pane of the form or create an advanced filter in the same pane. For details, see [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\GS_Filtering_and_Sorting_Mapref|Filtering and Sorting in Acumatica ERP]. ))) #You modify access rights to a form container for these roles. The ''Reprint'' and ''Reprint With New Number'' operations are stored in the ''ReleaseChecksFilter'' container of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_50_52_00|Release Payments] form. Initially, all three roles will have the ''Inherited'' restriction level set to the container and form elements. Thus, before modifying access rights to the actions, you need to modify access to their parent container. #:You change the restriction level set for the container from ''Inherited'' to a specific one. In this case, you revoke access to the container for the newly created role (<tt>AA_AP_Reprint_Checks</tt>), because you need to grant access to only to elements for this role. For the other two roles, you set the ''Delete'' level, because you need to restrict access to only two elements and allow access to all others. #After you modified access to the container, its nested elements still will have the ''Inherited'' restriction level. While calculating a restriction level for a user, the system takes into account only roles for which an explicit level is set. As you will use the granular role in combination with other roles, you explicitly revoke access for other roles involved and grant access to only the granular role.
The following table summarizes changes that need to be done. For details, on how the system calculates a restriction level for a user, see [HelpRoot_Administration\User_Roles_User_Access_Level_Calculation|User Roles: Calculation of Restriction Level for a User].[anchor|#_d9c6da0d-e86b-4432-abcd-40a67c60f596] ===Restriction level modifications need for configuring access to form elements=== {| class="checklist" | width="100%" |- | rowspan="2" | Roles / System Objects | colspan="2" | Release Payments (form) | colspan="2" | ReleaseChecksFilter (form container) | colspan="2" | Reprint and Reprint with New Number (form elements stored in the container) |- !width="14%" !
